MENNINGER: Briefly, your Honor. 4 THE COURT: Thank you. 5 REDIRECT EXAMINATION 6 BY MS. MENNINGER: 7 Q. You used these interviews of Jane in the grand jury; correct? 8 9 A. Not all of them. The interviews prior to the grand jury. 10 Q. Selective ones; right? 11 A. I'm not sure what you're -- 12 Q. You chose which of these statements of Jane to present to the grand jury; correct? 13 14 MS. COMEY: Objection, your Honor. 15 THE COURT: Sustained. 16 Q. You were just asked on cross examination whether Jane had an opportunity to review these notes before she testified; correct? 17 18 19 A. Yes. 20 Q. You could have shown her the notes before she testified; right? 21 22 A. That's not our practice. We don't -- we don't show witnesses notes taken by law enforcement. 23 24 Q. You couldn't have done it? 25 A. It's not ethical. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00016814

(In open court) MS. COMEY: No further questions, your Honor. MS. MENNINGER: Briefly, your Honor. THE COURT: Thank you. REDIRECT EXAMINATION BY MS. MENNINGER: Q. You used these interviews of Jane in the grand jury; correct? A. Not all of them. The interviews prior to the grand jury. Q. Selective ones; right? A. I'm not sure what you're -- Q. You chose which of these statements of Jane to present to the grand jury; correct? MS. COMEY: Objection, your Honor. THE COURT: Sustained. Q. You were just asked on cross examination whether Jane had an opportunity to review these notes before she testified; correct? A. Yes. Q. You could have shown her the notes before she testified; right? A. That's not our practice. We don't -- we don't show witnesses notes taken by law enforcement. Q. You couldn't have done it? A. It's not ethical.
